comments.body:
Referencing "Demons" by Imagine Dragons of course

Since Mojang has a history of picking music references for Advancement names, this is very fitting. +1

Maybe this could be a structure instead of a biome, like how Mineshafts work

If it's a whole biome it would need more biome features. These features should borrow from the Roofed Forest biome, where Mansions exclusively generate.

Suggestions: Large Mushrooms sprouting or Dark Oak trees growing on patches of dirt where there's enough space.

As a side note, maybe Mansions could generate underground in this cave biome, too? That would make them easier to find while still being tough to access.

It'd be great if Pillagers/Vindicators could spawn naturally in this biome, upping the danger factor. Maybe the Illusioner could spawn here too, if it ever gets fully added to the game.
We need these things!
We need these cousin of axolotl Olms would be a great feature to add to this delightful video game
They should spawn in dripstone caves!
They should only work if a hopper feeds items into them, to leave at least some use for the hopper.
Absolutely has my vote! Now that I can build a proper dwarven kingdom I require a proper steed upon which to defend it.

I was going to post a feedback very similar to this.  100% should be added, I cannot guess why mojang didn't do it in the first place.  I mean come on, who adds goats and even make them ram things and NOT have them rideable?  Also, why do I never see goats ram anything in the wild?  Do only some small percentage of goats have that ability or something?  I even hit one once to see if it would ram me and was really disappointed when it didn't.
I think so too but they should be ready hard to tame they buck you off in the air and it's a rare chance
please make the true rare axolotl the chimera i mean half blue half gold perfect
Oh, that could look cool. The wood could be in-between the color of dark oak and spruce, but also desaturated (with maybe a slightly more blue-ish/green-ish tint instead of brown).
Rather, they add normal trees but for deep caves in their negative version
I'm thinking either a dark bluish-green color 'tree' bark, or more of a graey/dark graey bark. With Deep Dark vegetation!
Wow, so creative *clap clap*. /s
em... maybe not an ore, but in the idea of granite and diorite, but ender... it would b better
I bet it will be op

That's just copying Netherite. And also, you didn't really elaborate much. :/

What makes it unique???
That kind of stuff should be added in an End Update rather than the Caves and Cliffs update.

Besides, there's not much you can upgrade towards when you reach Netherite in terms of tier. Having more armor slots would be overpowered, and so would having any more mining speed or strength. Updating the enchantment system and magic as a whole in Minecraft to add more varied steps to advancing your gear and character should be their next step. Tiers in Minecraft are simple and straightforward, and they should stay that way, in which case adding more high-end tiers would be pointless. The magic system should be what you use to spice everything up, rather than just pilling up the game with tiers. Just think about this; you upgrade to the highest-end base tier through the Nether, which fits the theme of the updated Nether quite well, then you expand your gear through the late-game using magic, possibly with mechanics heavily related to the End that allow all of the variety I'm talking about. This would work perfectly with the idea of the End being the final phase of progression in the game while still opening up a lot of possibilities for players. It would add a sort of sensible yet still completely arbitary progression line between the Overworld, Nether and End, with the Nether being a sort of "underworld" dimension that is still habitable and therefore has the highest end base tier, and the End being the final accomplishment and therefore opening up late-game possibilities that didn't exist in any form before.
We don't need purple netherite! And not so soon!
Just like as i think with other suggestions about this material I think it should be added, especially since the new Warden mob is coming to haunt this year's Christmas!
yeah you're right
They should have a small texture difference

Perhaps instead of a temple, remnants of a (forgotten, of course) civilization are added instead. It would look like a small simple room at the surface, but the more you explore the halls you find that it is a whole complex of rooms full of ideas, plans, lists, and pictures written in paper and in map/exclusive paintings, until it reaches the deepslate layer. When it reaches the deepslate layer, it will always end in a giant cave, and a large cylinder will extend from the room higher up into the cave. This cylindrical room has a gaping hole at the very bottom but a narrow walkway along the perimeter. Below the walkway is a ladder that extends down into the cave, but stops in midair. Of course this is very specific and is probably too similar to strongholds, but I was thinking about something along the lines of a woodland mansion, where you are exploring these dark rooms.
I like the idea of a stronghold-like structure that is not a stronghold.
Not sure about emerald. Hammers require 5 ingots instead of 3. And besides being able to mine, rightclicking on certain blocks would rotate or modify them, like a limited version of a debug stick.
In my version, they only require 2 ingots. And 3 sticks.

How I’d make it is hammers are only available in iron, copper, gold, diamond, and netherite. Each one is crafted with 6 blocks of said material (except for netherite obviously) and when used, they mine a 3x3 area. The hammer could also be used as a weapon. The cool down would be very long and maybe an enchantment the makes it when you hit the ground a shockwave is sent out, giving out knock back. To balance the hammer, I would make it so it takes both the main hand and offhand, meaning no shields or totems.
do you mean raw copper blocks?
Oiiii
I would like mining villages in the mountains.
The wardens not meant to be killed so they’re not going to do this.

They aren’t meant to be killed, but you should have a renewable source of skulk blocks. They do seem very rare, and it would be a way to just maybe get more. Besides, he is very hard to kill and you should get some reward for doing so, even if just more skulk blocks.

This is absolutely useless when you can't kill them. We don't know anything about how the blocks would spawn and whether we could farm them or not, but I'd say it is likely that once you find a certain Sculk block you can use it as a source for other blocks using a specific, unique mechanic. You're not meant to make farms for the Warden. I doubt it would ever spawn in a way that allows you to use Redstone to farm it, and I doubt you'd be able to build such huge contraptions in the Deep Dark without it detecting and killing you. For once, stop thinking about the Warden's drops. They declared a thousand times that the Warden is meant to be a natural disaster that you stealth around to avoid. It's meant to bring the horror of the first night to veteran/late game Minecraft player's and to a different level and theme. Being able to farm it even if you aren't directly killing it absolutely breaks that purpose. If it will drop anything, it will be a trophy item, and they're not even sure about that.
agreed, and even if you're not meant to loot them mobs dying without dropping anything is generally irritating. I'm especially looking at bats.
Yeah, they should drop a catalyst and some skulk, to make up for their large size.
Nice idea
I mean it makes sense, but I just don't see this gamplay wise

During Minecraft Live, they actually mentioned that Copper will come in Ore Veins instead of blobs like other ores. So when you find some Copper, you would often find it in huge amounts, to my knowledge. Copper is also a very special building block. It has this oxidizing factor, which makes it very unique. Quartz often just looks like White Concrete from far away. I'm not saying Quartz is bad, not at all, but from my perspective Copper is far much more appealing compared to Quartz. Quartz might blend in well, but Copper gives a lot more creative potential.

Cut Copper looks cool. And when it oxidizes it works really well with prismarine.

(But I agree it should have more uses... especially with redstone).
I really don't think they will add any more uses for copper right now, but instead do what they did with iron, and give it more uses in following updates.
Maybe copper should be used to make new redstone components such as hoppers
We need this!
Mushrooms should be able to grow on moss blocks.
I WANT IT PLSSSSS

I agree with this. As it is now, the lifecycle of a dripleaf doesn't make sense. Why have a baby version of the plant if it isn't needed to make more of them? Additionally, small dripleafs look more similar to the stems than the big dripleaf leaves do, so I think it makes sense. It'd also encourage the player to get inventive with redstone contraptions if they wanted to mass-grow a lot of small dripleaves into big ones.
Love this idea, these jewels sparkle in the caves and give out a bit of light source, so yeah
they would come would come with a new banner pattern, which is just a grass block

I actually really like this idea. It would make a player who climbed the mountain feel satisfied with his accomplishment. Also two ideas, 1. Maybe the loot table for he chest could have ice blocks in it because the only way to get ice blocks currently is from a wandering trader or a silk touch tool. 2. Maybe make an achievement for finding one.
Also, possibly you could pick them up and design your own flags such as for example pride flags, country flags, or just little doodles :D
I think flags could be treated like banners in most circumstances, like how their designs are made and whatnot.
Another opportunity to introduce the Deep Sea Monster (Mob A).

yeah the hostile mobs from that vote seems to be very important additions to the game in order to add more danger in the diverse places of the game, they shouldn't be simply removed forever from the game, they should just have the same concept filled by a different mob

or even sharks, dolphins could protect you from this.

Or electric eels would be fun that zap the water around them every few seconds.

certainly water area is not dangerous enough. There should as has been suggested be a large water boss.. like a kraken.
No its such a good idia to have a stone that isnt instaminable. And it creates a unique atmosphere

More blocks is usually a good thing for building, though. As for instant mining, you can probably still do it with gold pickaxes. The point of the block is to be more difficult to deal with, probably in part for the fact that diamonds will appear more often down there.

I don't understand your concept. Deepslate looks fascinating in the new caves (at least with Dripstone caves) and it creates a very interesting and grim atmosphere that would also perfectly fit with the Deep Dark biome. It also has a ton of building variants (much more than andesite or granite) so it is great to have huge quantities of it. As for the mining speed, this is also a cool gameplay feature; if you go below Y=0, the stone becomes much harder. Insta-mining is not essential. I don't see how that is unnecessary inventory clutter. It is necessary because of what I said above, and it is not even inventory clutter. If you're mining below Y=0, you don't need to take any regular stone with you, and you only find 2 stone types (Deepslate and Tuff), so there is less clutter than mining above Y=0. Besides, when was inventory clutter such a major issue that could cause the developers to remove entire blocks or change entire gameplay aspects?
I Belive That All Theese People Are Crazy, Do You Remember The "Deep Dark" Well Deepslate Gives That To Us... DONT REMOVE IT!!!!!
We already have Blackstone and grey concrete. And this is just more inventory clutter to worry about. Purly an aesthetic block that does nothing but be annoying for making quarries.
and deepslate could just be made to spawn only in the deep dark. And make it spawn underground like diorite.
If you are going to add it revamp bundles and make them able to hold 3-5 stacks. Or just make the inventory bigger.
And make it break slightly faster so u can instamine it with netherrite

I don't understand why you're whining so much. Inventory clutter is not an excuse to remove such a cool gameplay concept. I'm also not convinced that Deepslate contributes that much to inventory clutter. In fact, having it generate like Diorite would cause even more clutter. Deepslate can craft stone tools and furnaces just like Cobblestone and Blackstone, so you can just throw your Cobblestone away while exploring below Y=0. It's not like the addition of Deepslate would be the one thing that destroys your inventory while mining.

Deepslate is a very interesting block that gives a nice atmosphere for being underneath where the bedrock layer used to be. If deepslate is removed, the Minecraft world won't be high enough for comfort and that would mean that very few good generated caves will be found. Plus, if deepslate is removed then the Deep Dark will also likely be removed. I don't see why deepslate counts as clutter. It may be very good for building and, if removed, some players might be so sad they stop playing. If deepslate is removed, there will actually be MORE clutter because less ores will be mined, less houses will be built fast, and also bedrock is not very far down, because deepslate REMOVES the bedrock layer and puts it further down.
Its literally just greyer stone.
Did i say anything about the deep dark. mabybe just make deepslate spawn in the deep dark.
386737392752 If you were a builder, you would know that "grey concrete" is nothing like deepslate. The only thing that needs to be removed is the awful name.
it is soo hard to find diamonds know and apart from looking cool there isnt any benifiet of it.The soawn location of diamonds have changed i mean come on!

The stone that isn't instaminable is TERRIBLE concept that only makes annoying survival players.
It's Mining time just only nerfed how much people get diamonds, and since 1.18, there is no longer swamp-diamond-clay method, so it over-nerfed diamond farm rate.
After 1.18, Clearing End and farming end city is the 100% faster way to get diamond armor / tool sets, and there is NO NEED to mine it inefficient way.
Deepslate is the worst patch since 1.15 in minecraft, and they shouldn' make it, at least it's mining speed should have been a normal stone speed.

Due to this TERRIBLE, WORST concept to only makes Survival players angry and annoying, this patch is almost about to makes these player dumped as hard.
They should make its mining speed as normal stone do, and thats what Minecraft should do.
It's Minimal care what minecraft missed about.
Beta remove

There are a few things I disagree with here:

First, deepslate is one of my favorite building blocks! I think it looks amazing!

Two, deepslate is an indicator that you are deep enough to get the precious ores (you could use coordinates, but still).

I think we should keep deepslate how it is.
Deepslate is a trash , I have to waste time to mine cobblestone because that trash can’t craft many things
or maybe it drops bat leather to upgrade elytra and the double jump would make it easier to take off

I really like this idea. The glow lichen in the daylight adds a great faded look to blocks and helps develop block gradients, but when the light is gone, it loses this functionality for the most part.
